keyword: calories in a subway tuna sandwich
title: Calories in a Subway Tuna Sandwich
meta_description: Discover calories in a subway tuna sandwich, including macros like protein and fat, plus tweaks and FAQs for your Subway order.
h1: Calories in a Subway Tuna Sandwich
assumptions: 6-inch Subway Tuna sub on 9-grain wheat bread, with standard tuna salad (tuna, mayo), lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, green peppers; no cheese or extra sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, customizations, bread type, portion sizes, and preparation. Check Subway's app or site for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 6-inch Subway tuna sandwich contains about 480 calories and 20g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with Subway's info.

faqs.q: How many calories in a Subway tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: About 480 calories for a standard 6-inch version with veggies.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a Subway tuna sandwich?
Are Subway tuna sandwiches high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 850mg sodium due to the tuna salad and bread.

faqs.q: How does bread choice affect calories in a Subway tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Wheat or Italian bread is similar at ~480 kcal; flatbread adds ~50 kcal.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie Subway tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Opt for no mayo, extra veggies, and wheat bread to reduce to ~380 kcal.
